intro: Polygala thwaitesii, commonly known as the Narrow-leaved milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. The plant features slender stems and small, clustered leaves, with showy, pale yellow to greenish flowers that bloom in spring. It is part of the Polygalaceae family, which includes many species with unique floral structures. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and threatened species in some areas.
